Interface FailableByteConsumer<E extends Throwable>

Type Parameters:
E - The kind of thrown exception or error.
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface FailableByteConsumer<E extends Throwable>
A functional interface like ByteConsumer that declares a Throwable.
Since:
3.11

  • Method Details

    • nop

      static <E extends Throwable> FailableByteConsumer<E> nop()
      Gets the NOP singleton.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The kind of thrown exception or error.
      Returns:
      The NOP singleton.

    • accept

      void accept(byte value) throws E
      Accepts the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      value - the parameter for the consumable to accept
      Throws:
      E - Thrown when the consumer fails.

    • andThen

      default FailableByteConsumer<E> andThen(FailableByteConsumer<E> after)
      Returns a composed FailableByteConsumer like IntConsumer.andThen(IntConsumer).
      Parameters:
      after - the operation to perform after this one.
      Returns:
      a composed FailableByteConsumer like IntConsumer.andThen(IntConsumer).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if after is null
